summary: Italian is a Romance language that comes from Vulgar Latin, spoken in the Roman Empire. It's one of the closest languages to Latin and is spoken by about 85 million people worldwide, mainly in Italy, San Marino, Switzerland, and Vatican City. Italian is also used in music and opera. The language has a simple structure; most words end in vowels, and it uses a 7-vowel system. Italian is an important language in Europe and is the main language of the Holy See.
title: Italian language
